text:
The jspc commandline compiler does not support taglibs.  On any attempt to
compile a .jsp file that references a tag library, a NullPointerException is
thrown, as follows.

It appears as though the tldLocationCache is set to null in JspC, and it is
never set to a valid instance of TldLocationCache.  In order to construct the
cache, you need the ServletContext which is difficult to do when run from the
commandline.

----

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at
org.apache.jasper.CommandLineContext.getTldLocation(CommandLineContext.java:374)
	at
org.apache.jasper.compiler.JspParseEventListener.processTaglibDirective(JspParseEventListener.java:1764)
	at
org.apache.jasper.compiler.JspParseEventListener.handleDirective(JspParseEventListener.java:1236)
	at
org.apache.jasper.compiler.DelegatingListener.handleDirective(DelegatingListener.java:121)
	at org.apache.jasper.compiler.Parser$Directive.accept(Parser.java:289)
	at org.apache.jasper.compiler.Parser.parse(Parser.java:1172)
	at org.apache.jasper.compiler.Parser.parse(Parser.java:1137)
	at org.apache.jasper.compiler.Parser.parse(Parser.java:1133)
	at org.apache.jasper.compiler.ParserController.parse(ParserController.java:215)
	at org.apache.jasper.compiler.Compiler.compile(Compiler.java:220)
